metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2055 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
xymond/xymond.c in xymond in Xymon 4.1.x, 4.2.x, and 4.3.x before 4.3.25allow remote attackers to read arbitrary files in the configurationdirectory via a "config" command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xymon - 4.3.25-1
xymon-client - 4.3.25-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xymon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.25-1').
